values:
I am now in group guidance with mr. cecere.  it is extremely boring.  i am so tired. i got off with not having any actual homework today.  which is absolutely amazing and i am extremely lucky.  i finished my college essay this morning at 2am.  I got into a car accident this weekend.  it wasn't my car and it wasn't out fault.  that was wednesday night.

Wednesday/ i got out early, becuase i had on-campus last period.  so i left, though i had to be back for work.  i did tons of errands, got some food, and then went to work.  work was a lot of fun.  many people were in and out and i was kept occupied.  i met the head Sister Pat of the sisters of mercy.  it was fun.  i then went to cassies house to celebrate my birthday and have dinner.  it was fun.  then i went to choir, left early.  picked up brendan and then picked up kim.  we then went to starbucks, wendys, and like 5 other stores on rt. 6.  then we took brendan home and kim slept over.

Thursday/  There was no school because it was parent-teacher conferences. Kim and I met Sarah for breakfast.  It was very enjoyable, we then went and attempted to go to Swansea mall but it was Lt. Cabral's funeral, so all the roads were blocked off.  Of course we had a blast singing to Wicked, which is an awesome soundtrack.  ;-)  Then we went to school, because i had to drop off my budget project for Mrs. Pleasants, which was late, and we were supposed to help with costumes but that got canceled.  since it was brendan's birthday we picked him up from school.  i then dropped him off, got gas, and kim and i met him and anna in seekonk, where we went to literaly every single store.  then we went to brendans house for cake and then i took kim home, did a couple more errands, and went home myself.  I also had my interview for St. Michael's which i think went well.

Friday/ I went to Marist College in NewYork.  It was absolutely freezing but the college itself was gorgeous.  the peole were extremely nice and the campus was huge.  It took us forever to find it, and i met a really hot fire fighter who offered to take us in the fire truck to the college, but that's besides the point.  We gave ourselves our own tour and i loved it.  We got home around 8ish where i met adam and sarah for dinner and a night of fun.  i got home wicked late, but it was so worth it.

Saturday/ Brendan woke me up.  i picked him and and while plotting the mission with jess aganist him we had a blast.  i went to the car wash and him and i got a ton accomplished.  that night was his party.  we went bowling first, which i lost but it was fun anyway.  then we went to dave and busters, and luckily, the 5 of us were able to find games that we could all play.  i met tom the security guard and many other people.  we all did the chair thing, except AJ. lmao, i love you.  another late night.

Sunday/ went out to breakfast with AJ and Brendan.  Then i went to church.  Came home to help Paul rake leaves.  The leaf blower started to smoke at me, so i did the old rake and bag method.  i then went to Fatima, to watch my friends in The Wisdom of Eve.  Long play, 3 hours.  but it was good, for what we watched of it.  then we went to cara's house, where the cast party was.  AJ and i left and i stopped at choir.  i then picked up brendan, and i took them to my house so that AJ could meet Betty and Paul.  We stayed there for about 2 hours and then i finally took brendan home.  it was a lot of fun.  i then came home around 920ish to work on my college essay which i finally finished.

It was definately a great four day weekend.  group guidance is never ending.  i gotta go.  xoxo

Me

p.s. i love kai mc!!!! :-)
http://krummble.livejournal.com/11021.html

So i decided that an entry was fitting seeing as houw i had such a great weekend. 

Friday i didn't have school so i went out to breakfast with a few favorites, then went to SLS for a bit, hung out and some errands and  then home to go to Arbeat.  I thought it was going to be something really boring but it was extremely fun.  It was a live and silent auction at the Biltmore in the Ballroom with crazy amounts of people, gorgeous art, and many other things as well.  I met mayor david cicillene, karen adams, and others, all who amazed me in one way or another.  I had such a fantastic time.

Saturday i was supposed to go to NewYork but i did not because of many reasons.  So instead i got up, showered, did the hair, you know, all that, and got Brendan.  We went to the mall, made dinner for Betty & Paul, and hung out until about 10ish.  It was an awesome day.

Sunday was church first, singing in choir, the usual, then open house for hte academyy.  We sang and we didn't sound that bad, some of the songs came out really good.    I then sat in my seat listening to the speeches, marcia newbert, my hero, did a fantastic job.  I then took my group on our tour.  It turned out extremely well, and was so much fun.  I even got a few compliments, but what can i say, im obsessed.  I then went to go and see my little sister where i was stopped and told to come home for a big dinner right away. We had a very important guest stop by.  Makes you wonder huh?

Well i am going to attempt to do a lot of homework, but i am extremely tired so we'll see how it all goes.  School tmrw, then work, then choir, then starbucks, the usual ish. 

Hope all is well with everyone.  Love you all. 

Stephie Krumm
http://krummble.livejournal.com/10766.html

Sorry it's been forever, i've been so busy.  So i am finally a senior, it's hard and scary and crazy and stressful, but at the same time i've waited for this for a long time and now that it's here? i'm not too sure. 

I am at work right now.  I have nothing to do, well i do, but i am choosing not to do it.  I am really tired & i just sealed about 300 envelopes.  one hour and one minute till i can leave.  What should i start on?  i am kind of excited for college.  My giving up on life phase finally ended.

Some days i have so many questions that can't be answered.  I hate that.  haha, that was random.

Homecoming is tonight but i will be in vermont visiting colleges and speaking at St. Michael's College.  I will be back on Monday seeing as how it is the long weekend.  Tomorrow i am taking the SATs!!!! again.  I hope i do well, i need to do well.  I hate standerdized testing.  ugh boring.

I am so happy to be back at school, though now that i work here, i notice more and more crazy things about this place.  It's all good though, it's not very nice weather outside, which i think means the game might get canceled.  I am in the process of getting a new car, because my car, cellica, miserably failed me and the brakes fell off while i was driving.

Though i would love to continue to go on and to ramble and tell you all about meaningless things that go on in my life, i feel that with the time i have left i should be doing something productive.  After all, it all needs to get finished anyway. Mind as well start well i can.

I hope that you are all doing well and yea.

love you

love...me
http://krummble.livejournal.com/10513.html

so today was a good day.  Got to school nice & early, went to the ambassador mtg, and then classes.  First was Christian Lifestyles haha which was an extremely fun class.  Next was Health class w. Mrs. McGrath, who i absolutely love.  Then American Lit, which honestly wasn't that bad.  Except i absolutely bombed my quiz because i didn't know we were having one.  Last was psychology and i love that class, its always a good time.  It was early dismissal today and so i went to work early.  S. Lister sent me to development to file papers for a bit, & then when i came back down, i did a bunch of things for S. Betty.  Then her meeting started and i sat at the computer and did my homework, which i accomplished quite a lot of.  Work ended at 5 and then i drove home for dinner with Betty because Paul is away.  Then i went to Barrington for choir practice, and it was St. Luke's Open House so i stopped in to see everybody.  We sang so many songs in choir today.  Then i went out to starbucks with an old friend, and then went home.  Now i am watching a movie, and probably getting ready for bed.  Hope your all doing well, love u.

Love,

   me
http://krummble.livejournal.com/10366.html

Ok, so it's been a while since my last update.   Things are going really well.  & im having fun.  Senior year has finally started and i am beyond excited.  It's going to be a good year, and i can't wait.   Goodness, so much to update on.  must get off the computer though.  Update again soon, actually i just might.  Haha soo much love to you all.  I hope you all had a really spectacular summer.  Talk to you again soon.

 

 

Love ,

Stephanie Elizabeth Vandana Krumm
http://krummble.livejournal.com/10174.html

Ok so i am still in NewYork.  practically only two more days.  It's been a lot of fun here.  I got to spend a ton of time with andrew and tomorrow is the big suprise party, for the people here anyway!! i am absolutely excited.  Today i went to Oneota and went shopping, again and this past week, has actually been really fun.  It's so gorgeous in Delhi, i wish i had  a camera.  We went to Mindskill yesterday, which was so much fun to see andrew at camp and then were going again in about an hour.  I also got to ride the horses and i have gotten a ton of stuff accomplished while i have been up here.  Which is definately a good thing, since when i get back, i still have at least 3 weeks of work left.  By that time, school will almost be starting again. I would update more, but there is so much to write, and i want to go paint my toenails.  i just thought a little update was in order since it's been a while? i don't even remember when my last entry was.  well i am off and i will be back in RhodeIsland on Sunday.  Hope everyone is doing well.  Academyy girls, see you soon, maybe even sooner if your going to the yearbook thingy.  yay.  haha i don't know why i just said that.

Love,
    Me
http://krummble.livejournal.com/9860.html

Ok so i don't even know where to begin.  Summer has been so much fun but absolutely crazy at the same exact time.  I have been working at camp, which is alway's a blast and doing about six billion other things.  I have attempted to start my summer reading and do my math packet which is finally online.  I have been moving, and placing animals, and visiting the kids, and just trying to have fun and make the most of the summer.  I am in New York till the 7th visiting my little brother!!!!!!!! yay i missed him so much.  The whole family is actually doing well, which is really good.  Right now i am doing some serious work for a program i am running and writing my speech for my cancer benefit i am supposed to be speaking at.  MY little brother and i are watching Dumb and Dumber and then we are going out to eat.  I am not sure how i feel about all of this, or anything, it's all still so unreal and it hasn't even hit me yet.  I am really tired and here in Delhi, it is absolutely freezing compared to Rhode Island.  Well i have so much more to do, that i better be going.  Just thought an update was in order, seeing as how it's been a while.  Hope everyone is doing extremely well and is having a fantastic summer.  For my academy girls, i miss you all and will see you again very soon in the fall.  Send me your schedules and maybe we have some classes together.  Well i am off to work and watch movies and do who know's what else.  Delhi, is practically in the middle of nowhere.  But whatever.  Keep in touch kids, call me up, i miss you all 633 4145.  Love you guys.

<3 Stephanie Elizabeth Vandana Krumm

Wow.  it's been ages.  it really has.  I hope that everyone is doing well and i hope that everyone is having a super fantabulous summer.  i have been working with kids and cleaning out hte house.  so much is going on.  my mother passed away and im not sure what to think of it all.  i am so tired but also having soo much fun this summer.  it's all going ot work out and its all going to be really good.  yay!! im excited for the future.  i've got big plans.  well im off to desert with some absolute academyy favorites.  i hope everyone is doing well and i think you should all give me a ring. 633 4145.  much love kids. a spectacular day today...

well to start it off.  i had to make it to school for like 6:45am.  which honestly, is the time i get there normally.  haha

We made a travel to heifer farm today for junior experience.  i had a blast. katie was my partner.  holler for us.  haha i love you.  we started off with a movie, & then we went & pet a bunch of cute cute cute animals.  we then got to make our lunch, from scratch practically.  which came out awesome & tasted sooo good.  holler for tailand & for chryssy & katie. then we went & got a tour of the farm.  then we shoveled poop.  Mrs. Cleary had the time of her life laughing at me. she was waiting for me to fall over.  nice huh.  Sister Liz was our tour guide along w. Life is going pretty damn good.  ;-) don't want to jinx it.  well kids i have a lot left to do but def. cell me & we can chat.  much love to you all.

http://krummble.livejournal.com/6916.html

as im sure many of you know, jen's dad was killed this past week.

wednesday was the wake...
which was extremly sad.  as the 12 of us ( bay view girls ) stood in line, none of us knew what to make of it.  as we got closer there were collages that jen & her sister caitlin had made.  they all looked like there father, & it was just so sad. we all went through the line & then chatted with rebecca for a little bit. 

thursday was the funeral...
that was one of the saddest things i have ever done, ever

thousands and thousands of cops from taxas, california, canada, and many other places came out and showed their support. i was part of the honor guard at the funeral, it was amazing to see all of the officers and the horses and well everything. when they took the body out of the hurst and lead the family into the church the officers started to shout something and then all of them at the same time gave a salute it was really touching. it was such a beautiful mass.  so sad, but so beautiful. there were so many symbols that went on throughout the mass & funeral. they had a cop car and a decestive car in front of the hurst with black blankets on the front showing the sign of mourning also with the officers badges they put a black stripe across the badge #. then there was the music and the rideless horse. it was a horse that has no one ridng on it now i wonder were they got the name lol anyway it had a black blacket on it and in the saddel was a single boot. the horse was being pulled along by the officer. the funeral was so sad and moving i cant explain it and i hope no one ever has to go to a funeral like that. i didnt cry at the funeral i got some tears in my eyes.  i think that watching jen & her mom & caitlin & even rebecca cry, made me more sad.  jen & her family are very strong people.  so sweet & loving & caring, so sad.  they will always be in my prayers & in my heart. the mass went really well, it was sad but many of the things that were said were very nice.  the euology was absolutely beautiful, so well done, spoken by the chief commanding officer of the providence police department, i think? his name was paul kennedy & he was also a friend of the familys. one of the things they said at the mass was that "life as to end, but it doesn't mean love does" which is very true, everyone will always love and remember mr. allen.  one of the other detectives, i think she was, sang a song that she wrote, which was so sad & moving about mr. allen. the procession to the cemetary was 2 hours.  every little thing that we all had to do in order to pay our respects was worth the time, the effort, the commitment, & everything.  jen, caitlin, marge, you are all in my prayers & in my hearts.  if you need anything, ever, let me know.

ohh & by the way Saint Michael is the saint of police officers, if im correct.  well im out kiddos.  i promise that my next entry will be a happier one, like all the others, but its been one of those weeks, & i can't wait for school.  i need my school, were i feel safe & its my comfort zone, my second home, & i just love it.  but i will miss the seniors who only have 18 days left.  i love you girls.  & i wish you all the best also.

<33 effie

Rest in peace Detective Sgt. James Lloyd Allen

well a lot has been goiing on lately.  im not really sure what to make of it all.  Jen's dad died, & thats soo sad.  he didn't just die because he was sick or something, someone shot him.  its so sad.  i give her so much credit for coming into rehearsal everyday, but then again, its the thing to do.  umm, cabaret is coming along.  slowly but its getting there.  its kinda sad knowing that it'll all be over in less than 2 weeks.  the seniors are graduating which is also really sad.  my mom is still really sick.  i love cabaret & april vacation.  its soo much fun to spend it with people who i love.  its going to be a really good show this year.  well i have a lot more to write, but at the same time, i feel as if i am at a loss for words.  so i will catch up with all yuo kids tomororw.  love you all..

Stephanie Elizabeth Vandana Krumm
http://krummble.livejournal.com/6642.html

lets start with Drama Festival which was absolutely spectacular.!!!

The Bay View players are the most beautiful people I have ever met. I love Cabaret sing alongs on the way to Cranston West, Matt and Mary, the fact that Emily and Simone came to see us, Emily Kunkel who made my night, Andrew Brown and his Director pin, and being part of such a phenomenal cast and performance. It's all about the ensemble....and it was. Congrats.

Drama Fest all day Saturday. We watched 8 shows, beginning early in the morning with Hendricken's "Wall," which was written and directed by the amazing & talented Andrew Brown. Every single boy in that piece, all six of them, made me incredibly proud and I just kind of sat there thinking "I love my friends." There were high points such as that, but there were also some very low points. I guess that is to be expected. We ate lunch in a classroom and then watched Cranston West's production of Cinderella. Matt and Mary, the absolute best hosts everrrrr, made sure to point out the horses. Haha. We went out to dinner at Nicole's, which was nice but kind of rushed. The "42nd Street" kids came to the DF Dance Rave instead of performing last night. The rave was actually incredibly fun, once i decided that i didn't care i had mono & just went all out & made the best of my time.  I even got to do the "Cotton Eyed Joe" with some amazing kids! God is Good....he knows that Cabaret couldn't have afforded us winning. So we're the alternate! I'm so proud of all of the Players. We're beautiful, and sophisticated, and should definitely get the spirit award. Congrats to St. Ray's and Cranston West for moving on to the regional competition. (i have to say, i was extremely suprised by that but hey ) And congrats to Angie, Andrew, and Colin for making the All-Star cast. You guys rock my world.

& now i just got home from rehearsal and received a suprisingly good report card when i thought it was going to be horrible. Other highlights of the night were when Sarah costumed me in a dress that finally fit & we decided to dance around the costume room and when she sang "Come On Get Happy." i had soo much fun with andra & with some other crazyy kids, playing w. camera's & passing notes.. Oh dearrr. I love Cabaret. after school i attened the workshop since i want to run for executive board next year.. Oh how I love this time of year. Classes went well today as well. i had social issues, where we didn't do too much.  Then i had history, where we worked on packets. for the record i love Mrs. Haines, she is soo hilarious & that class is so much fun.  Then chamber where we got an on-campus & i hung out in Ms. Cunningham's room & did some crazyy errands. then i had anatomy & i disected my pig with Katreena.  that was a fun time haha. ohh i love my crazyy life that keeps me going & never lets me stop.  i love my crazy schedules, cabaret, rehearsals.  . and it's sick nasty.

im out kiddos.  i love you all.  leave me somethin hott.

<33 effie
http://krummble.livejournal.com/6176.html

yet another spectacular day.  School was fine.  I got to leave early to join some of my Bay View Players on our excursion to Cranston West for our Drama Fest tech run. Our hosts, Mary and Matt, were obsessed. Matt grinned through the entire run, which I found thoroughly amusing. We stopped at the BK Lounge on the way home for some dinner. Kaitlin had called ahead to warn them of our arrival, but apparently they thought it was a prank call and didn't take her seriously. I really do have an obsession with the Players and with all the crazyy fun we have. Haha. Now that was an interesting conversation to say the very least. Cabaret tonight was fun, but empty. There were five boys. It was basically a free-for-all all night and people auditioned for parts in different songs.  yay, i auditioned for a song.  sweet.!!

<33 effie
http://krummble.livejournal.com/6014.html

So this weekend has been kind of crazy.  For some reason i have absolutely crazy amounts of work.  I have gotten a lot done though.  im suprised.  Friday was school, & health fair which was a blast.  Beth, Ms. Edsall, & I tried catching bean bags w. the drunk googles on, & then Beth & I, ( since we had spent almost all day at the health fair ) went to chill w. the army guys at the rock climbing wall exhibit thing.  Which i totaly made it to the top that morning & back down in less than 5 minutes.  The boing extreme obstacle course was soo much fun.  i only went on it about 50 times. haha.  then i ended up meeting the Nesquik guy who apparently knew who i was.  Then the blood drive guy also knew who i was.  haha, i deff got a little keychain car from the AAA people, & i got my bloodpressure checked. The lady seemed pretty worried when she noticed how high it was. haha. then we just hung out & i ended up getting a huge bowl of sherbert ice cream & flowers :-)...of course i had also had 8 pieces of pizza at the fair. haha.  then i went home & did homework & chores & errands on Friday night.  haha, im a loser.  Then Saturday the pope died.  its weird to know that we are witnessing history.  look for the white smoke.  I also got my prom dress fitted & went out to lunch & now all i need for prom is a date.  haha, i'll have to get on that this week.  Then i just hung out & went to play in the rain.  a delightful time.  i have to say, i was kind of upset to lose an hour of sleep since i don't sleep enough as it is, but extremely happy because spring is finally here, and that excites me!!  today, i am still working on the insane amounts of work that i have to do, & then the rest of my chores.  My room is coming along quite nicely.  i can't let it get this bad again, haha.  well i am off, kids need attending to, & so does my room & all my work.  have a good night kids.  love you all.

<33 effie

Phenomenal

that pretty much sums up the day...in every sense....today was such a spectacular beyond that day.  First period was Social Issues which was interesting, i just wrote notes haha.  Second period History, fun, haha love history.  Third Period was chamber.  we ate & got ready.  last period was showtime.  the show went soo well & i am so proud of everybody.  People actually like it, which was awesome.  Then i went out with most of the cast to applebees.  Which was always an enjoyable time, i have to say.  the ride home w. my lovies was spectacular.  there are def. some weirdos out, hahaha. We had a lot of fun.  then it was back to perform it again.  but before that we had a pop jam 90s music section. then was showtime yet again, & it went really well.  Then spring concert, we def. had an on night.  can i just say i love hilary & cooper.  haha.  ohh & kav as well.  she has a way of making you night.  haha.  then sarah bought me home, we had a nice little chat on the way, & now i am off to do nothing, because health fair is tomorrow, & im not doing anything. haha.  loved today. loved it loved it loved it.

great job tonight ladies, you did spectacular.  ohh &

Congradulations to Hannah for getting into Harvard...YAY YAY YAY YAY YAY...

i honestly love the academyy more than words describe. the things that go on & the things you go through & experience are things you can't get anywehre else.  spectacular...or as we would say

phenomenal
